meanings.definition: A person or thing that continues or carries on a process or activity.
meanings.sent1: The continuators of the project ensured its success.
meanings.sent2: The continuators of the race passed the baton smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The continuators of the party kept the music playing all night.
meanings.sent4: The continuators of the flame passed it on without letting it flicker.
meanings.sent5: The continuators of the story made sure it never ended.
meanings.sent6: After the teacher left, the continuators took over the lesson.
meanings.sent7: The continuators of the tradition carried it forward with pride.

meanings.definition: A verb form that indicates the continuation of an action or state.
meanings.sent1: The continuators of the verb showed ongoing action.
meanings.sent2: The continuators of the sentence kept the meaning flowing.
meanings.sent3: The continuators of the play kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent4: The continuators of the melody kept the tune going.
meanings.sent5: The continuators of the journey never stopped moving.
meanings.sent6: The continuators of the song kept the rhythm steady.
meanings.sent7: The continuators of the film maintained the suspense.

meanings.definition: A noun form that refers to someone or something that continues a particular tradition or legacy.
meanings.sent1: The continuators of the family business upheld its values.
meanings.sent2: The continuators of the dynasty preserved its history.
meanings.sent3: The continuators of the recipe added their own twist.
meanings.sent4: The continuators of the art form brought new life to it.
meanings.sent5: The continuators of the legend kept the story alive.
meanings.sent6: The continuators of the custom honored its origins.
meanings.sent7: The continuators of the ritual followed it faithfully.
